intro: Gomphandra lysipetala, commonly known as the slender gomphandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
